intro: Dasyphyllum hystrix var. peruvianum, commonly known as the Peruvian spurge, is a succulent plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and branched stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and arid landscapes. Due to its hardy nature, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry climates.
